title: README Meta-Documentation Template
description: Documents the prompts and source files used to generate each section of README.md

sections.prompt: List the key components provided by this collection: (1) Count and categorize all agents in the agents/ directory, (2) Count and list the core workflows from context/workflows/, (3) Mention the methodology documentation availability, (4) Reference command templates. Be specific with numbers and accurate counts.

regenerationInstructions.overview: To regenerate README.md, process each section sequentially using the prompts and source files listed above.
steps: 1. Read all source files specified for each section
2. Apply the section-specific prompt to extract relevant information
3. Verify counts and numbers against actual file system state (use verification queries)
5. Preserve static elements (diagrams, legal text) that don't change
6. Update dates and version numbers from pyproject.toml
7. Cross-reference between sections to ensure consistency
verificationChecks: Agent count matches: ls agents/*.md | wc -l = 11
Workflow count matches: ls context/workflows/*.md | grep -v README | wc -l = 4
Command count matches: ls context/commands/*.md | wc -l = 6
All agent names in tables exist as files in agents/
Version number in Quick Start matches pyproject.toml version

fullyAutomatable: Agent count and list (parse agents/*.md files)
semiAutomatable: Tips and best practices (extract from dedicated sections)
manuallyMaintained: Real-world examples (require human judgment for realistic scenarios)
Philosophy narrative (requires synthesis of multiple sources)
Quick start examples (balance between completeness and brevity)
